primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God overcomes the human limitation of 'imagined scarcity' through the performance of 'divine abundance' in creation, history, and Christ.

subject.identificatie: God (specifically in the person of Jesus and the Creator)
tekstueel_bewijs: God can and will do abundantly what is beyond our imagining
God overruns our sparse imagination and enacts abundance

object.identificatie: Abundance/Life-support (Bread, inclusion, material and spiritual sustenance)
tekstueel_bewijs: abundance of life-support that is given for all

zender.identificatie: The Triune God / The Gospel Truth
tekstueel_bewijs: The news of abundance... is the truth of the gospel

ontvanger.identificatie: All creatures (universal scope), specifically the 'fearful' hearer
tekstueel_bewijs: satisfying the desire of every living thing
enough for everyone, all creatures of our God and king

helper.identificatie: Biblical agents (Elisha), Jesus, and the Eucharist
tekstueel_bewijs: Where God’s agent is present, loaves abound!
The Eucharist is the great drama of abundance
Our imagination of scarcity comes out of fear
those immobilized in anxiety who live in a fetal position of fear
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Scarcity is presented not just as a mistake, but as a systemic 'human limitation' that blocks the recognition of God's reality.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The church (the Jesus movement) performs this abundance in the world as a response to the primary program.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church / 'Folks like us'
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The church's action is explicitly framed as a result of being 'overwhelmed' by God's prior action.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Gospel Truth → Abundance → Every Living Thing

voorbeelden_god_subject: God keeps breaking beyond our imagined scarcity
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We want our kids... to hustle

voorbeelden: we want to be sure we get and keep our share
The news of abundance... is the truth of the gospel
God who is able to do far more abundantly

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is centered on God's 'Ability' (Pouvoir) which overwhelms human 'Inability' (Scarcity).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Starts at S2 (Scarcity), moves to S1 (God's Abundance), which negates S2 and leads to ~S2 (Doxology).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God's performance of abundance (S1) 'casts out' the fear of scarcity (S2).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; scarcity is shown to be the root of systemic racism and exclusion.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject who provides what humans cannot imagine or achieve. Human action is a secondary 'overflow'.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential for 'Abundance Business' to become a new law
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: the Jesus movement... are in the abundance business

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of transformative verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God overruns our sparse imagination and enacts abundance

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Elisha and Jesus are not models for us to copy, but agents of God's power.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: 'Where God’s agent is present, loaves abound!'

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from anxiety; movement from fear to gratitude.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic provision: God provides the 'Pouvoir' that humans lack.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from God's abundance to the church's mission is logically and theologically integrated as 'overflow'.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'material' abundance and the reality of global hunger is left to the 'mystery' of the text.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Perfect love casts out fear! Perfect abundance casts out scarcity!

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'power at work within us' is mentioned but not developed pneumatologically.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is 'fear' and 'anxiety' that creates systemic injustice (racism, exclusion).

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of a theocentric narrative where God is the Subject and the human condition (scarcity) is the Opponent overcome by Grace (Abundance).

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Slightly more Savoir (How the church practically 'performs' this in a world where scarcity still seems real).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Connect the 'Eucharistic bits of bread' more explicitly to the 'Pouvoir' of the Spirit.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful grace-oriented sermon that avoids moralism by making God's 'Pouvoir' the engine of the narrative.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'all' repetition; Greimassian analysis shows 'all' functions as the universal scope of the Receiver.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek 'huper-ek-perissou'; Greimas shows this word functions as the 'Object' of value that defeats the 'Opponent' of scarcity.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'scarcity' mentioned is not just a theme but the narrative Opponent that requires a divine Subject to defeat.

appendices.notnotes: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Exemplarism' trap by framing Elisha and Jesus as performers of God's power rather than models for human effort.
